Reviews.Title: “Friendly little hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Bjorn O Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very good location. Friendly staff. Clean rooms. Breakfast room very small but nice. Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel..Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Robert F
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel very enjoyable. The room was very clean. The hotel staff were very friendly. We woke up at 10am when breakfast was suppose to be over and the young women held it for us. Breakfast area is quaint. Breakfast was enjoyable. Hotel is within several blocks of the Vatican, Vatican Museum & Sistine Chapel. We only had one day in Rome as we were heading to Naples. You really need a few days. We would highly recommend staying here and would again. You also must remember rooms are small, as most hotel rooms are in Rome. 1/19/2012

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel with cheap rooms and a great location”
Reviews.Author: deired
Reviews.Content: the hotel has such a good location that in 4 days i only used the publin transportation once to go to the colosseum, because all other places you would want to see are near the hotel(10-30min away). the rooms are small but they look very good, are clean, with a small tv, a refrigerator, internet accees. the breakfast was great-you have a lot to choose from. i would go there again also for the small price of one room comparing it with other similar hotels in that area. the only bag thing is that you can hear almost everything is happening in the other rooms

Reviews.Title: “Horrifying Service - Good luck entering the hotel after 9pm”
Reviews.Author: siftarkm
Reviews.Content: I am currently using the Hotel Papi wifi: My wife and I just came back from dinner tonight and we could not enter past the street gate. It is only 9:30pm and if it was not for a patron leaving the apartment complex, we'd be stranded outside our own hotel. We rang the buzzer for the Hotel Papi repeatedly but no one buzzed us through the street gate! So we continued to press the button for the Hotel Papi and sat out on the street. Once a resident from the complex came out we entered past the street gate. Next was the locked building door. We pressed the button for the Hotel Papi again and FINALLY someone buzzed us through. When I explained all of this to the gentleman at the front desk I was treated rudely. He said he was at the desk and insisted I did not press the right buttons. I am 110% certain my wife and I pressed the correct buttons. No apology from the gentleman at the desk. Had noone come out of the complex, we would have had to check in at another hotel for the night!! Scary thought... right now we are worried that if we head out for some gelato, we'll face the same neglect and not get through the street gate. If you love an unexpected adventure, then this is the hotel for you! Just book another hotel if you plan on leaving the Hotel Papi after the street gate closes.

Reviews.Title: “The location was great - the room, not so much”
Reviews.Author: Javasmurf
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 5 nights. We had no trouble finding the hotel and everything seemed fine at first sight. After staying in the room for the first night, though, that all changed. The room was noisy, due to it being only a few meters from the reception. We woke up several times each night from people being buzzed in and loud talk in the reception. The room was very hot, although this was in March and the temperature outside wasn't that high. The AC didn't work correctly, so we could choose between either a very cold or a very hot room. The view from the window was of a back alley with little light coming through it. I recieved information on how to connect to the wireless internet, but I couldn't see the access point at all in the room. I finally got a weak signal to another access point that I could use, but only at one very specific location in the room - everywhere else, the was no signal at all. The room was very clean, so no complaint whatsoever in that department. The service wasn't excellent - and it frankly seemed like some of the employees viewed guests as somewhat of a nuisance - but it was acceptable and one of the employees actually went beyond the bare minimum, providing assistance and advice. The location of the hotel, however, is great and we could walk to pretty much everything in Rome. But I'm not planning on staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Bring a plunger for Roma dei "Poopa"”
Reviews.Author: tgiam
Reviews.Content: Good central physical location, very small rooms, bare amenities, extremely tight eating area – 8 people max. Cappuccino great! Staff very friendly – Irena, Franchesco, Hugo. Air conditioning fair to poor - one room worked well, other room was terrible – had staff adjust several times, still much hotter than other room. Helped to open windows to get breeze, not safe at night. Room was very clean, booked two triple rooms – got two twins and folding bed – barely enough room to walk around – NO dressers. Limited place to store clothes – small wardrobe. Views of alley or street. For a couple of nights, location may be worth it, but make sure you test everything and don’t be surprised about “additional” invoices/charges or threats to call the police as normal maintenance. Due to the frustration and threats – I would not recommend any American to stay there with your family – maybe by yourself or a couple. Breakfast was a couple of pastries, slices of salami or ham and orange or apple juice. Close to Vatican, Castle St. Angel and Piazza Navonna. Lots of noisy construction nearby, not so much a hotel as a collection of rooms (about 7) in a three apartment building complex. Graffitti prevalent. Room walls marked up and chipped. Toilet got plugged (confirmed normal usage), Hotel manager blamed my family, charged $150 EU and threatend to call police if we didn't pay (not pleasant at all).

Reviews.Title: “A horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: mluijten
Reviews.Content: What a horrible experience! The hotel is small, rooms are small, the beds are way to hard. We booked the hotel for 5 nights and after 2 nights we wanted to check out. Our room was 102, next to the reception (as almost all rooms) and breakfast room. The breakfest is very poor, the coffee machine makes so much noise that you wake up at 7 and during the night every customer has to ring the doorbell twice to get into the hotel. Every night we woke up 6-7 times, it was horrible. When we asked to check out and gave the list of complaints we where threathend by the police if we didnt pay for 5 nights. I never experienced domething like this in my whole life! We checkout, payed 5 nights and stayed 2 nights in another hotel to get some sleep after 3 sleepless nights. I would never ever advise someone to stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: danystorm
Reviews.Content: There were just too many problems with this place. The room was tiny, and no matter what we did, we couldn't seem to get rid of the mosquitoes. We had problems coming and going, since there are two different "checkpoints" you have to cross to get into the hotel - which is more like someone's apartment. (They have to buzz you in every time.) The staff was unhelpful, they acted like their guests were a nuisance, and they treated the one woman who works for them pretty poorly as well. We couldn't get the "free Wi-Fi" to work in the room, only in the reception lobby, and cell phone service didn't work in the room at all. Our room was in a corridor just behind reception, and the walls were so thin we could hear everyone coming and going all night. The room smelled horrible. The breakfast was stale. It's also not a very good neighborhood for dining, we had to do some serious walking to find a meal. There is a grocery store on the corner, but when you're traveling, that can be a pain. Given the exorbitant prices they charge and the poor quality overall, I would not recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing...”
Reviews.Author: Ara_AZ
Reviews.Content: This is not really a hotel, but pretends to be one. We reserved a triple room but got a double room with an uncomfortable portable bed added. The room is too small and noisy. The bathroom is tiny. The sinks don't drain. Some fixtures have no light bulbs. There is no lobby to speak of. The breakfast room is tiny with plastic tables and chairs. The staff is nice but they can't do much. The only positive attribute of this hotel is its location. It's a ripoff for its price even in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Took Care of Our Every Need!”
Reviews.Author: LandMCampHill
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Roma dei Papi. The entire staff was extremely helpful with city directions, information regarding sites that were a must see, transportation to the airport, restaurants to visit ( although there are many on the main streets we wanted an unusual place to go), etc. They were a very friendly staff that made you feel most welcome. The hotel was located within a very nice, secure building......it is very clean and up to date in style.... towels and soap were changed every day. The location of the hotel was a very safe area giving us no concerns regarding safety especially at night. It is within walking distance to many main attractions and only minutes from the Vatican. Breakfast, including coffee, was enough to get us started every morning. We were very pleased with our stay and would highly recommend it to anyone visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and very helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: eyeheartravel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved everything about this hotel. The staff was extremely helpful and courteous from even before we arrived. Very helpful through email with setting up "limo" service upon our arrival in the Rome airport. They were also very helpful with suggestions for sights and restaurants. The room was a tad small but we felt it served its purpose as we were out of the room 90% of the time anyway. Small but very clean and sleek room and bathroom. Bed was a little hard but again, served its purpose after a looonng day of walking and sightseeing. Great location to all nearby important sights - I'd say in about 5 minutes we were at the Vatican and surrounding area. Located in beautiful building but if we didn't have a limo driver there to actually show us where Roma dei Papi was - we'd probably never have found it! It is hidden within a building. No big deal to us...just something I figured would be important if you were to drive or find it on your own! Breakfast was small, but expected in Italy. Excellent coffee and ate Nutella every day :) You will not be disappointed by your stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Nice budget stay!”
Reviews.Author: jholdust
Reviews.Content: Roma Dei Papi is a nice little place with about 8 -10 rooms. Room is clean neat and nice and the location is excellent once you get it the first time :) The staff is courteous and ready to help at all times. Quite a few restaurants around the place and the vatican is just a few mintues away from the hotel. Breakfast is allright and on a budget this hotel is good enough.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, central and beautiful area.”
Reviews.Author: fifitrixi
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Rome having stayed in the Roma dei Papi hotel. We got the shuttle from the airport which had been arranged with the hotel for €50, it brought us direct to the door and the chauffeur brought our cases into reception for us. It doesn't look like a hotel from the outside but looks lovely nonetheless. The room we were allocated was very spacious, with a large bed, international tv stations, mini bar, telephone,hairdryer, safe and ensuite. The room was lovely and warm and I had the best 2 nights sleep ever. As it is a family run hotel I was just expecting a croissant and coffee for breakfast, but there were cereals, ham, cheese, juices, teas etc. as well. The breakfast area was compact, though it didn't matter as we couldn't wait to get out and explore what Rome had to offer. The area surrounding the hotel is great, beside the Castle Saint Angelo and Bridge, which are fantastic landmarks, and only up the road is St. Peters Square and the vatican. Across the river is piazza navona/ pantheon and surrounds with great restaurants everywhere. We recommend getting the hop on hop off bus and it stops just across from the castle on your way back to the hotel. It is also good for going to Termini if you need to catch the bus back to campino airport. It was €18 for 24 hours and €23 for 48 hours. It also gives the history of Rome as you travel. If I was going to Rome again( which I presume I will after throwing my coin into the trevi fountain) I would definitely stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: tntravel908
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very centrally located. You can walk to most of the major sites. This hotel is also close to 2 different bus stops. Very safe area. The room was very clean and breakfast was good. Only downside was the bed was very firm. Front desk staff was very helpful when we needed directions.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Carole72
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice little hotel, beautifully located for walking to Vatican, Piazza Navona, Pantheon and other sights in Rome. It was spotlessly clean and had no unpleasant bathroom odors which we have experienced in other small hotels. Some reviewers experienced problems finding the hotel, but our taxi went right to the address which we had written out for him, and we knew, from other reviewers, to look for Scala B and ring the bell (there is no hotel sign). The staff was friendly and helpful; called the airline to confirm our departure flight. Upon arrival we found a bottle of wine chilled in the room to celebrate our anniversary. The only down side to the hotel is the breakfast. We do not expect eggs, bacon, etc in small European hotels; however, we do expect good bread or rolls and good coffee. Breakfast consisted of sliced bread from a package, thickly sliced salami, Kraft cheese slices wrapped in cellophane, croissants, and yogurt. There was no fruit, fresh or canned. The coffee (there was a choice of "American" from a coffee pot or espresso or cappuccino from an espresso maker) was very "thin" with hardly any coffee taste--like not enough coffee grounds were used. That said, we would stay at Roma dei Papi again; but we would buy good rolls to take to breakfast, as we did the last morning of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Alissa C
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at the Roma dei Papi for 3 nights while visiting Rome. The rooms were impecably clean, the bathrooms were spacious and it was overall a lovely experience. Breakfast in the morning is served in the little dining area and it's plentiful and very good. The hotel staff was incredibly nice and helpful - and although a few of them spoke very little English, it wasn't frustrating at all, they were so patient to work through the language barrier! The only difficulty we had with this hotel was finding it! There is no signage on the building for the hotel or the address, so we were lugging our bags around for quite some time trying to find it! But, the location is wonderful, just across the street from Castel San'Angelo and about 2 blocks from St. Peter's/Vatican City.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: cpatogo
Reviews.Content: The perfect location within 20-30 minute easy walk from much of what of what Rome has to offer. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful especially during the crisis of being the victim of pickpocking at the Pantheon. The room was small but extremely comfortable and clean. Coffee, espresso and baked goods were available everymorning, a COOP was two doors down the street and a number of good restaurants just around the corner. I would highly recommend this small hotel to anyone who wishes to experience our favorite city in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Nice lil hotel”
Reviews.Author: Krishnakumar V
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a nice place to stay in Rome. It is close to vatican and is in a very beautiful locality. Very short walk to the fantasic piazza novona and the spanish steps. The rooms are clean and neat although the shower is very small. The staff are EXTREMELY gracious and helpful and that alone makes up for any other minor niggle (average breakfast, small noise creep). Overall, we enjoyed our stay at the Papi de charme and definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bellojoseph
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel from 9/19 - 9/22/07. Hotel staff are excellent - very helpful and kind. Gave great advice on directions, dining, etc. Room is simple but clean. Hotel is perfectly situated for visiting all the main sites by foot. Highly recommend and would definately return. Breakfast a little sparse but common for Europe.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent small hotel”
Reviews.Author: harburytravellers
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a five night trip to Rome. This was our first visit. Through Trip Advisor we found a really good small hotel, the Roma dei Papi, perfectly situated near the Castel S. Angelo, a short walk from the Vatican and within easy reach of all the main historic sites. Stefano and Arianna, who both speak good English, are a delightful young couple who run this hotel with the aim of making all their guests feel personally welcomed and looked after. We found them to be most helpful. The rooms are well equipped and comfortable with excellent bathrooms and one of the best hotel showers I have ever encountered. The hotel arranged our transfers to and from the airport which we felt was well worth the 50 euro fare. As the hotel is situated in a large condominium it might have been quite difficult to find without the driver's help. You have to go through the door of 5B of the building and only then do you see the sign for the hotel. Despite being in the city with traffic all around we found our room to be absolutely quiet. As public space is limited in this 8 bedroomed hotel there is no lounge. Arrangements for breakfast are a bit cramped but the breakfast itself is very good with delicious Italian croissants. We shall definitely return. David & Gillian Winter UK

Reviews.Title: “Take Care!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ca_s92
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very good. Clean, good location, excelent breakfeast... But I was stolen for someone that it works in the hotel, in my room when I wasn´t there. They took two shorts of mine. I won´t stay there never more.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Madscot
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Roma dei Papi Hotel last week, May 29 - May 31st, 2007. We really have no complaints. It was a great location, perfect for walking to all the sites. We easily walked everywhere we needed to go, including the Coliseum/Forum area, Vatican, and Spanish Steps area. We booked two rooms directly with the hotel in January and the communication process was wonderful. They were very hepful with questions we had prior to arrival. The hotel is a bit difficult to find. We were driving in from Florence, and had a GPS system with us that brought us right to the door, otherwise we would not have found it as it is not marked. The breakfast in the morning is great. The chocolate croissants are awesome! The hotel asks for cash payment, which worked out well for us. Just be aware ahead of time to have cash on hand. The rooms were clean and comfortable. There is a computer near the lobby for free internet access. The staff is extremely helpful and polite. It made our stay in Rome even more special.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: kvesterb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at hotel Roma dei Papi for three nights, arriving in the middle of April. The hotel is located just across the street from S.Angel Castle. It was a bit difficult to find the first time, with no bigger signs by the street. So keep your eyes open for the small parking lot at Piazza Adriana n°5. Roma dei Papi is a small but friendly hotel, the staff was excellent! The room was clean and comfortable with air-condition and satellite-TV (mostly channels in Italian). The breakfast was really good and gave you a good start in the morning. The location of the hotel is excellent with all the big “must-sees” at walking distance. We had a very comfortable stay at Roma dei Papi, and we can absolutely recommend it if you are searching for a small but cosy hotel in the heart of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great and clean”
Reviews.Author: stefanovas
Reviews.Content: We have been at Roma dei Papi for 3 nights. It was a very good experience. Hotel room was big, very very clean and new. The 2 owners, Arianna and Stefano, together with Luisa are doing a very good job. You can see they love what they are doing and they were always very friendly. Free internet in the lobby. Breakfast buffet included in the rate. From the hotel, located at the basement floor of a roman building, you can be in just 15 min. walk in Piazza Navona. Piazza San Pietro is even closer. You are just behind Castel S. Angelo. The only little negative point was that it was a little bit noisy at breakfast time (our room was very close to the lobby, but I'm sure that they will do something about it in the future). By the way, they are planning to get some more room in the same building at a higher floor. We strongly recommend to book a limousine service to and from the airport. Just 50 euro from Fiumicino. We would recommend this hotel to anyone and we will certainly be back in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Simply The Best”
Reviews.Author: Chele78
Reviews.Content: I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. Arianna, Stephano and Louisa are be the most friendly and helpful hotel staff you could wish to meet. We were presented with a map of the city on arrival and shown all the routes to take of areas of interest. The room was so clean, modern and bright. A lovely size room and bathroom. Breakfast really quick with minimum fuss. Eat as much as you want. Excellent value for money. Our enjoyment of the city was enhaced greatly by Roma dei Papi. A big thank you to you all. We will be back!!! Michelle and James

HotelInfo.Name: Roma dei Papi - Hotel de Charme
HotelInfo.Address: Piazza Adriana 5 | (Scala B) (Gate B), 00193 Rome, Italy
